pullrequest.title: Add Scene requestor class for populating Scene3D

content.raw:
Something which can be handled later:

1. Launch `ign-gazebo` using [this PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/41/new-system-scene-broadcaster/diff)
1. On the left menu, choose `Save client configuration as` and choose a file, such as `/tmp/test.config`
1. Then on the menu choose `Load client configuration` and load `/tmp/test.config`

You'll see that the scene shows up with a black background and the shapes look weird.


| Before | After |
| -- | -- |
| ![before_shapes.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2904205922-before_shapes.png) | ![after_shapes.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/569365851-after_shapes.png) |


If you inspect `/tmp/test.config`, you'll see that all the options are the same as in ign-gazebo's `gui.config`. And if you try to use it as follows, you'll see that the GUI displays the exact same as the "Before" above. So I suspect the problem is not in the saved file, but in the reloading of a `Scene3D` plugin within the same session.

~~~
ign-gazebo -v 3 -f ../test/worlds/shapes.sdf -s &
ign gui -v 4 -c /tmp/test.config
~~~
